Articles.Content: What are you worst ksp fails?(plane, rocket or plocket!) Id love to know(because I love trying to screw up worse..........my space center is going nowhere, is it?)
When testing one of my early attempts of an Eve return design on Kerbin, I found out the importance of the parachutes being attached above the center of mass.

Whenever i massively overengineer my rockets,(IE:minmus lander with a completely obsolete second stage with which i landed instead of the actual lander...) and the costs that come with it (not to mention the lagz of such oversized monstrosities). i do it all the time...

26 minutes ago, RobinVerhulstZ said:

Whenever i massively overengineer my rockets,(IE:minmus lander with a completely obsolete second stage with which i landed instead of the actual lander...) and the costs that come with it (not to mention the lagz of such oversized monstrosities). i do it all the time...

Something like this.

40 minutes ago, purpleivan said:

Something like this.

 

kinda,heres the pic i have http://imgur.com/a/lvu5Z
Isn't there already a thread for this purpose?

Wobbly ships is my major thing. i have a habit of tall rockets qnd they go all floppy

Then there's the fail designs, launching a station with 4 lifts and forgetting the power, an antenna, solar panel that kinda thing
I tried to make a bearing the other day, but instead I made an unstable Kraken drive that lasted ten seconds.

On 11/26/2016 at 11:02 AM, imkrazy said:

What are you worst ksp fails?

Expecting it to make some sort of sense.
Tried to make a plane and it could not even get off the ground.
I made a plane that had to achieve velocities surpassing Mach 1 in order to take off. I don't know where I placed the screenshot, though...

On 27.11.2016 at 1:30 PM, RobinVerhulstZ said:

kinda,heres the pic i have http://imgur.com/a/lvu5Z

After several times this happened, I REALLY stopped bothering with landing legs for low-gravity bodies.

On 11/27/2016 at 4:30 AM, eloquentJane said:

Isn't there already a thread for this purpose?

yes, but i wanted to start my own.

On 11/30/2016 at 5:20 PM, imkrazy said:

yes, but i wanted to start my own.

Mods don't like that.  Brace for merging.

I should really get a screenshot of when one of my xenon monstrosities fails near the pad.  Such a carpet-bombing.
In the 1.2 update, communication has been added. One time i forgot to put on my Comms, so i lost connection underway to Jool, pretty sad.

My most recent fail is that I sent a mission to Duna and they pulled off their objectives without issue and then burned for home.  I got an encounter with Kerbin but I forgot to do a midcourse correction to fine tune it.  They entered Kerbin's SOI but they were so high in the gravity well and were going so fast that they didn't have enough fuel to get a capture and come home.  I then launched a big expensive rocket with a probe core to go rescue them and bring them home.  I set my maneuver node to execute an escape burn that would get me a close rendezvous as well and started to burn only to realize that my node had me pointed into Kerbin's atmosphere and the rescue craft wound up burning up in atmo.  I then launched another big expensive rescue rocket only to realize after putting it into orbit that it doesn't have an antenna.  I then launched yet another big expensive rescue rocket (my agency is now almost bankrupt) and this time I put an empty three man capsule on it for the crew being rescued and a one man capsule for the pilot so that I don't have to have a damned probe core and antenna this time. lol.  Here's hoping this one works.

Today Jeb learned what the E.V.A. button does:

He also learned to never press it during flight, the hard way . . .

Still kudos for making this fly though.

Yes, there is no pilot in the cockpit anymore, hope Jeb has insurance...

Edited December 30, 2016 by Triop
A plane that could either accelerate on the ground or fly, as it was so underpowered.

• Don't have pics, but I always manage to get to Duna and not have enough fuel to get back.
  • My first Duna mission I forgot to add batteries and always ran out of power when I tried to send my science back home.

On 26-11-2016 at 6:02 PM, imkrazy said:

What are you worst ksp fails?(plane, rocket or plocket!) Id love to know(because I love trying to screw up worse..........my space center is going nowhere, is it?)

KSP regularly fails me but who says I fail KSP?

This unmanned test:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=845996285

the plane was on top of a size 3 rocket meant to lift it to space. Thanks to CoL being in the plane while CoM was in the booster, and a lack of struts causing one of the strap on boosters to detach before the engine started, it flipped at about 150m uncontrollably. I then panicked went through abort procedure and staged through the list to try to save the plane. It ended up crashing nose first into the ground and had the front part of the body bent to the left. 

There also is the many rockets in the demo that flipped during launch and never made it to space. And the time I stranded someone on the far side of the mun, and then made the same mistake twice with unmanned landers for rescue attempts, then forgot to extend the solar panels on the next attempt, and finally landed one successfully nearby. And the time Bob exited for an EVA during reentry.

Edited January 21, 2017 by 53miner53

When to Laythe in Science mode, got the whole way there, surprisingly.  All was well, got into orbit and such, and decided to do the landing on the northern ice cap of Laythe.  This was mainly due to the fact that I was to low on Delta-V to have corrected my orbit, before and after I think.  When doing the landing I realized something I should have realized back in the VAB.  I forgot the parachutes.  Amazingly, after a few tries, I just barely landed, having had to use up every drop of liquid fuel and oxidizer at my disposal. 

Parachutes... 

Always parachutes.
